@rswr
-right click on the game and chose "show package contents"
-click on "wineskin" and chose "set screen options"
-on the right side uncheck "use mac driver instead of x11" and quit

@noonnak, how do I apply the update to a mac? The file includes battery.nfo,  crack folder (steam_api.dll and steam_api.ini) and update folder (changelog.txt and Tomb.Raider.Update.v1.01.743.0.exe)

@patwik
-right click the game and show "package content"
-double click wineskin and chose "install software" and click "choose setup executable"
-find the update (tomb.raider.update.v.01.743.0-Bat) folder.
-choose tomb.raider.updatee.s1.01.743.0.exe
-click browse and find the folder nam "Tomb raider" and click extract
-open the crack folder and copy the files inside
-paste it inside the "tomb raider" folder and click applied to all (if it don't have a replace files option then it is the wrong folder)
-sorry for my english
-then quit all and play

Sorry,
I had a zip file from the other post you made. I downloaded this one, had te dmg file.
To make it work, I went to set screen options, unchecked "use mac driver instead of X11", et checked "override", and chose fullscreen. It worked like a charm, if this can help anyone :)
@noobnak, thanks for the instructions for the update but the menus are still gibberish
@noobnak, what's the difference for the game about checked or unchecked "use mac driver instead of X11" ?

@mjchch, Mac X11 lets you run applications that were developed on UNIX computers using the X11 system seamlessly on a Mac. It is installed with Mac OS X in the Utilities folder within the Applications folder. Most of the games on wineskin use X11. Not much difference between Mac driver and x11 but sometimes mac driver run some games better than x11.
